unnormalised: So, someone asked about buying veggies and groceries, huh? Well, let me tell you about my experience. Last week, I went to the local sabzi mandi in Andheri. Needed to stock up for the week, you know? First thing I saw was tomatoes selling at ₹60/kg. Bargained a bit, got them down to ₹55/kg. Not bad, not bad at all.
normalised: so, someone asked about buying veggies and groceries, huh? well, let me tell you about my experience. last week, i went to the local sabzi mandi in andheri. needed to stock up for the week, you know? first thing i saw was tomatoes selling at rupee sixty per kilogram. bargained a bit, got them down to rupee fifty five per kilogram. not bad, not bad at all.

unnormalised: Then, moved on to potatoes. They were going for ₹25 per kg. Bought 2 kg, so that's ₹50 right there. The aloo wala tried to give me less, saying his weighing scale was off by 50 grams, but I caught him! Gotta be sharp, you know? Always check the weight, especially at the mandi. I prefer buying from local vendors to support small businesses. I feel I can better bargain too.
normalised: then, moved on to potatoes. they were going for rupee twenty five per kilogram. bought two kilogram, so that's rupee fifty right there. the aloo wala tried to give me less, saying his weighing scale was off by fifty grams, but i caught him! gotta be sharp, you know? always check the weight, especially at the mandi. i prefer buying from local vendors to support small businesses. i feel i can better bargain too.

unnormalised: Next up, onions. Essential for any Indian household, right? They were priced at ₹30/kg. Took 1.5 kgs, cost me ₹45. Plus, some dhaniya and pudina for free – that's always a win! The shopkeeper always bundles those in if you buy enough. Feels good to not have to pay for all the little things!
normalised: next up, onions. essential for any indian household, right? they were priced at rupee thirty per kilogram. took one point five kilograms, cost me rupee forty five. plus, some dhaniya and pudina for free – that's always a win! the shopkeeper always bundles those in if you buy enough. feels good to not have to pay for all the little things!

unnormalised: For groceries, I went to D-Mart. Needed rice, dal, and atta. Basmati rice was ₹80/kg, got 5 kg. Toor dal was ₹120/kg, got 2 kg. Aashirvaad atta was ₹350 for a 5 kg pack. Spent almost ₹1000 there! Felt like a lot, but it’ll last us a good month. I use that for baking my favorite Naan Bread.
normalised: for groceries, i went to D-Mart. needed rice, dal, and atta. basmati rice was rupee eighty per kilogram, got five kilogram. toor dal was rupee one hundred and twenty per kilogram, got two kilogram. aashirvaad atta was rupee three hundred and fifty for a five kilogram pack. spent almost rupee one thousand there! felt like a lot, but it’ll last us a good month. i use that for baking my favorite naan bread.

unnormalised: All in all, the whole trip cost me around ₹1500. Not too bad for a week's worth of supplies, I think. Always compare prices, bargain where you can, and support your local vendors! You can find what you are looking for in no time at all.
normalised: all in all, the whole trip cost me around rupee one thousand five hundred. not too bad for a week's worth of supplies, i think. always compare prices, bargain where you can, and support your local vendors! you can find what you are looking for in no time at all.
